item.title: Mini Heroes: Magic Throne Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
Mini Heroes: Magic Throne is a mobile game in the idle genre. In it, you will lead a team of small but strong characters on a dangerous journey through uncharted territories with a bunch of different enemies. Unfortunately, you won't be able to help your team directly in the battle, as the fights are completely automated. But you can unlock the better characters and upgrade them.

To do this, you will need a lot of currency and various items. Many of them you get passively during the game, but we still recommend that you redeem Mini Heroes: Magic Throne codes. They will bring you in-game currency and boosters that will make your journey easier and more enjoyable.

All Mini Heroes: Magic Throne Codes

Working Mini Heroes: Magic Throne Codes

  • PMB8FD - Enter this code to get x288 Diamond. x1 Gold Coin Pack (12h), and x3 Silver Badge.
  • MARS777 - Enter this code to get x300 Diamond, x10 Rare Minted Coin, x3 Hero`s Exp Pack (2h), x3 Gold Coin Pack (2h), and x5 Mythic Hero Fragments.

Expired Mini Heroes: Magic Throne Codes

There are no expired codes for Mini Heroes: Magic Throne yet. When they appear, we will add them to this section.

Often in free mobile games, you can redeem codes to get rewards. They can be useful not only for beginners but also for experienced players. In Mini Heroes: Magic Throne , for redeeming codes you will receive not only game currency but also rare items and boosters that will significantly accelerate your progress regardless of your stage of development. So if you want some freebies, make sure to use the codes above before they expire and you miss out on the rewards.

How to Redeem Codes in Mini Heroes: Magic Throne

In many mobile games, it's easy to redeem codes, and Mini Heroes: Magic Throne is no exception. However, the interface can be confusing, so sometimes understanding what to do can take some effort. So here is how to redeem codes in Mini Heroes: The Magic Throne .

  • Open Mini Heroes: Magic Throne and complete the tutorial.
  • In the lower-right corner of the screen, click the gray button with three dashes to access the menu.
  • Select the Settings option at the top of the list.
  • Next, click the Redemption button.
  • In the field, paste the code from the list of working codes and click Redeem.

Please note that some codes may expire over time, so there is a chance that you will not be able to receive rewards. To prevent this, redeem them as soon as possible.

How to Get More Mini Heroes: Magic Throne Codes

As with most free mobile games, the easiest way to get new codes is to bookmark this guide in your browser, as it will be updated regularly. You can also find information about the new Mini Heroes: Magic Throne codes on the developers' social media:

  • Mini Heroes: Magic Throne Facebook page

Mini Heroes: Magic Throne is available on mobile devices.

item.title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 Players Are Angry With New Update
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Modern Warfare 3 players are angered by the new Call of Duty update after it deletes all game files.
  • The shooter's latest update introduces a new UI overhaul for the Call of Duty HQ app ahead of the release of Black Ops 6 on October 25.
  • Fans were forced to re-download Modern Warfare 3's multiplayer, campaign, and Zombies mode, as well as the entirety of Warzone.

Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 players have taken to social media to express their anger with the game's latest update, which implemented a brand-new UI for the Call of Duty HQ app while also deleting users' game files. The 55GB Call of Duty update is available to download now on all supported platforms, and while it includes all of the multiplayer and Zombies files for the upcoming release of Black Ops 6 , Modern Warfare 3 players have been left fuming after being forced to re-download all of their game files.

With Black Ops 6 now just days away from releasing, Activision has opted to give the Call of Duty HQ app a fresh lick of paint with a brand-new user interface. While Call of Duty 's new UI update is just one of the many changes being made in preparation for Black Ops 6 , it's one that's going to impact every Call of Duty player, regardless of whether or not they've pre-ordered the upcoming shooter. Unfortunately, players who plan on sticking with Modern Warfare 3 have been left irritated after the update not only uninstalls their game files, but installs Black Ops 6 .

Call of Duty 's UI overhaul has been highly anticipated by players, but nobody anticipated that the update would completely wipe the game files for every Modern Warfare 3 and Warzone player. Shortly after the update was deployed, fans realized that Modern Warfare 3 's multiplayer, campaign, Zombies, and even the entirety of Warzone needed to be reinstalled. Players were also left irritated as the update installed the game files for the upcoming shooter's multiplayer and Zombies modes, even for those who haven't pre-ordered Black Ops 6 .

Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 Players Angered After Update Deletes Game Files

Over on the Modern Warfare 3 and Call of Duty subreddits, numerous posts are calling out Activision for forcing players to redownload numerous game files. Reddit user Kyeithel said that they were disconnected from a multiplayer game and forced to update their game, only to discover that their files had been deleted after the fact. They then referred to the update policy as "nonsense." In response, Reddit user Fortunes_foe said that the Call of Duty HQ app is "the worst launcher ever" and stated that "it's amazing how bad it is."

Although the update has caused plenty of controversy, Activision says the new user interface will allow users to manage their Call of Duty games more efficiently. As all-new Call of Duty titles now fall under a singular app, the overall storage size has been a common complaint in the game's community. With the file size of Black Ops 6 being roughly 145GB when all three modes are installed, players will find that the Call of Duty app takes up roughly 300GB with previous games installed. But thanks to a new UI, it's now much easier to manage which games and modes are taking up precious hard drive space.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is set to launch on October 25, and to hype fans up for the shooter's release, publisher Activision and developer Treyarch have been publishing new blog posts each day for the last week. From every weapon mastery camo in Black Ops 6 to the game's return to the classic prestige system, each blog post reveals even more exciting details on the next entry in the Call of Duty series.

item.title: Diablo 4: Bleed Thorns Barbarian Leveling Build
item.description:
Barbarians have a number of builds they can go with as they're leveling in Diablo 4 , but if you're looking for one that requires little effort on your part, then a bleed/thorns hybrid setup is what you need. It's a little gear-intensive, but a build that makes demons fold under the sheer weight of your aura is both hilarious and surprisingly effective.

The following build works somewhat similarly to the Spiritborn Centipede leveling build for Diablo 4 . It relies on compounding Thorns with a DoT effect (Bleed, in this case) to deal copious amounts of damage to all enemies. This mainly caters to players who are yet to reach level 60, and while a completely new player can definitely try this out, they may not be able to draw its full potential unless they have certain Legendary Aspects that may be hard to to get for a first-timer.

Diablo 4 Barbarian Bleed Thorns Build (Season 6)

In essence, this is a Rend/Rupture and Barbed Carapace build. As far as general mobbing goes, all you have to do is shout and watch as enemies near you start taking damage . This is possible thanks to the Barbed Carapace Key Passive, which makes all nearby enemies take 100% of your Thorns damage every second after you cast an ability with a cooldown. Use Rend and Rupture to deal with elites and bosses.

Your active skill bar should look like this:

Skills (and Point Investment)

Upgrades

Flay (5/5)

  • Enhanced Flay - Flay has a 15% chance to inflict Vulnerable.
  • Combat Flay - Gain Damage Reduction and Thorns when you deal direct damage with Flay. Stacks up to 5 times.

Rend (5/5)

  • Enhanced Rend - Dealing direct damage with Rend extends the duration of Vulnerable.
  • Furious Rend - Dealing direct damage with Rend grants 5 Fury per enemy hit, up to 25 Fury.

Ground Stomp (1/5)

  • Enhanced Ground Stomp - Generate 60 Fury and has a 2-second Stun duration increase.
  • Tactical Ground Stomp - Ground Stomp is now a Brawling Skill. It deals 900% damage and inflicts Vulnerable for 4 seconds.

Rallying Cry (1/5)

  • Enhanced Rallying Cry - Grants Unstoppable while active.
  • Tactical Rallying Cry - Generates 20 Fury and grants an additional 20% Resource Generation.

Challenging Shout (1/5)

  • Enhanced Challenging Shout - Gain 20% bonus Maximum Life while active.
  • Strategic Challenging Shout - Gain Thorns equal to 30% of your Maximum Life while active.

Rupture (1/5)

  • Enhanced Rupture - Ripping your weapon out causes an explosion that deals Bleeding damage over 5 seconds. This damage scales with your Strength.
  • Fighter's Rupture - Hitting at least 1 enemy with Rupture heals you for 22% of your Maximum Life.

Putting any skill points into abilities other than Flay and Rend usually isn't worth it, as the bonuses are too small to make any meaningful difference in lower levels. Spend those points on passive skills, and if you have nothing else to spend them on, level up either Rupture first to reduce its cooldown, or Challenging Shout to improve your survivability. Make sure to get as many Altars of Lilith as you can for the free skill points.

As for your Technique slot , go with Two-Handed Sword just to squeeze out that extra bleed damage. You can also go with Two-Handed Mace if you want more Fury generation.

Important Passive Skills

  • Pressure Point
  • Warpath
  • Outburst
  • Tough as Nails
  • Belligerence
  • Booming Voice
  • Pit Fighter
  • Cut to the Bone
  • Irrepressible
  • Barbed Carapace

Warpath, Belligerence, Outburst, and Tough as Nails are your main damage passives. Prioritize ranking them up over the others.

How to Play The Build

This build is very simple to use, but to make the most out of your abilities, keep the following things in mind.

  1. Always keep Combat Flay fully stacked for free damage reduction, bonus Thorns, and bonus damage from the Belligerence passive.
  2. Use Rend regularly to get up to 120% bonus Thorns thanks to Barbed Carapace.
  3. Challenging Shout will give you even more Thorns and damage reduction.
  4. Rupture's first hit will always Overpower, triggering the Warpath passive.
  5. Use Ground Stomp to stun, generate Fury, get rid of weak enemies, and create damage-boosting Earthquakes (with the help of a Legendary Aspect).

Recommended Gear And Aspects

Apart from getting the usual stats like Damage, Resistances, and Armor, always be on the lookout for armor pieces with Thorns damage, Damage Over Time, and Maximum Life . Use Amethysts on your weapons, Rubies on your armor, and Diamonds on your accessories. Make sure to complete bounties at the Tree of Whispers in Diablo 4 to get tons of loot and XP while leveling.

Legendary Aspects

Slot

Aspect

Amulet

Skullbreaker's Aspect

Rings

  • Needleflare Aspect
  • Aspect of Earthquakes

1H Weapons (Axes)

  • Rapid Aspect
  • Edgemaster's Aspect

2H Bludgeoning

Aspect Of Retribution

2H Slashing (Axe)

Aspect of Inevitable Fate

Chest Piece

Iron Blood Aspect

Helmet

Aspect Of Anemia

Gloves

Weapon Master's Aspect

Legs

Aspect Of Might

Boots

Exploiter's Aspect

If you don't have all the Legendary Aspects listed above, at least get Skullbreaker, Retribution, Needleflare, and Anemia from the Codex of Power. Anemia lets you stun bleeding targets, while Skullbreaker and Retribution greatly increases the damage you deal to them. Meanwhile, Needleflare will help you deal more AOE damage by spreading Thorns around and between enemies.

Once you reach level 60, you can transition to either a full bleed build with Gushing Wounds and high crit stats, or a Berserk Thorns build with Double Swing , Death Wish Aspect , and Berserking stats. Replace your chest piece with Razorplate as soon as you get one.

item.title: One DLC Proves Minecraft and Animal Crossing Would Be a Match Made in Heaven
item.description:
Ever since Minecraft launched on consoles, Mojang has been churning various DLC packs filled with skins, textures, and worlds for players to explore. While many of them have cost money, there have been a couple that have overhauled the experience for free. One such pack came in the form of the Super Mario Mash-Up Pack, which brought Nintendo's biggest IP to the Minecraft world. And now that the studio has tapped into Nintendo's catalog, there is one franchise just waiting to be adapted in the blocky world.

Although it may not be as big as the Super Mario franchise, the Animal Crossing series has become a behemoth over the years. Players have been able to explore this colorful world across a variety of titles, including a Mario Party -like experience, a home designer, and a mobile game. With the release of Animal Crossing: New Horizons , the franchise took on a whole new level of popularity. Yet, Nintendo has not really embraced its crossover potential, but a Minecraft mash-up pack could change all of that.

Minecraft and Animal Crossing Could Be the Greatest Crossover Yet

Minecraft Has Already Explored Nintendo's Biggest IP

With the release of Minecraft on the Wii U, Mojang fully tapped into this new market by also including the Super Mario Mash-Up Pack for free. While a big highlight of this pack was the Mario-themed skins, this was far more than just another skin pack. Alongside those came new textures, music, and an entire pre-made world themed after Super Mario Bros . Through that, players not only got the classic Minecraft experience, but they were also able to have free-range of some of the most iconic locales from Mario 's expansive history.

Since its release on the Wii U, the Mario Mash-Up Pack has become a staple of every single Nintendo version of Minecraft . Additionally, Minecraft 's own Steve has gotten to join in on the Nintendo fun through Super Smash Bros. Ultimate DLC. Even though it may seem like the two companies have embraced the crossover potential, there have not been any more Nintendo-themed mash-up packs since. But that could all change if the studio were able to take Animal Crossing for a spin.

Animal Crossing is Brimming With Crossover Potential

As of now, the Animal Crossing series has not really had many notable crossover appearances, outside of Nintendo crossover titles like Super Smash Bros. Ultimate . The franchise has had its fair share of titles and references appear within, but it has not really branched out much. However, the series feels rife with crossover potential, and Minecraft could be the home of its biggest.

Already, Minecraft and Animal Crossing share some similarities, with both putting a heavy emphasis on building within a mostly barren world. Additionally, Animal Crossing: New Horizons fully tapped into crafting, which is a Minecraft staple. Of course, the two games are in completely different genres, but through a mash-up pack, they could become even closer.

This Animal Crossing mash-up pack could give Minecraft a brand-new facelift, with all sorts of textures themed after the colorful franchise. Along with that, there is virtually unlimited potential for player skins, as the Animal Crossing franchise features countless unique villagers throughout its many titles. And if that was not enough, K. K. Slider's tunes would be the perfect companion piece to any Minecraft adventure while a themed world would be fantastic to explore.

It currently does not seem like Mojang has any Nintendo-themed Mash-Up Packs in the works, but hopefully that will change. With a new Nintendo console looming on the horizon, it feels like the perfect time to tap into more of Nintendo's expansive library, starting with the iconic Animal Crossing series. The potential for something great is there, so now the studio just has to be given free range to explore it.

item.title: Roblox: Glider Simulator Codes (October 2024)
item.description:
Those who want to conquer the skies but lack wings can do so in Glider Simulator . By shooting yourself out of a cannon, gliding through the skies, and collecting coins, you can progress by purchasing more aerodynamic aircraft and powerful cannons. But, if Roblox players want to quickly buy a couple of custom trails for a more stylish flight, they should use several Glider Simulator codes.

Of course, the codes will not give players tons of currency to buy top-end gliders and will not allow them to unlock new worlds faster. Instead, you will receive in-game currency to make your start in the game more colorful.

Updated October 22, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: All the codes in this guide are still active. Be sure to redeem them before they expire.

Glider Simulator: All Codes

Even though Glider Simulator has kept Roblox players happy for several years with enjoyable gameplay and many updates, the developers are not too generous with free rewards. To get the best that the game offers, you must fly a lot, improving your skills and traveling between worlds. But if you still want to get a small initial capital of gems, use Glider Simulator codes from our list below.

Active Codes

  • TENKAY - Enter this code to get 750 Gems
  • IMHUNGWY - Enter this code to get 300 Gems.

Expired Codes

There are no expired codes in Glider Simulator . But we will update this list as the codes expire.

Glider Simulator: How To Redeem Codes

Fortunately for fans of gliders and smooth flights, the ability to redeem codes in Glider Simulator is available from the first seconds in the game world. Here's how to do it:

  • Launch Glider Simulator in Roblox .
  • Click on the Twitter icon on the left side of the screen.
  • Enter the code in the Input Code Here text box.
  • Click Submit, after which you will receive your rewards.
  • You will receive a corresponding notification if the code has expired, or you have already used it.

How To Get More Glider Simulator Codes

As we said, the Glider Simulator developers don't share new codes very often, so you shouldn't expect frequent gifts. However, if you are optimistic and want to keep up to date with all the news and exclusive rewards, you should subscribe to the official page of the game on the X platform. Alternatively, join the official Roblox group to learn about all the rewards and secrets that you might have missed from other players.
